actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

official_title: To prohibit insurers from offering monetary rewards, penalties, or inducements to licensed health care practitioners' on the basis of the health care practitioners' decisions to limit the availability of appropriate medical tests, services, or treatments.
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Health Care Integrity Act of 1996 - Mandates regulations to ensure that insurers do not offer monetary rewards, penalties, or inducements to health care practitioners or condition the practitioner's continued participation in a plan on the basis of the practitioner's decisions to limit the availability of appropriate medical tests, services, or treatment.

titles.title: To prohibit insurers from offering monetary rewards, penalties, or inducements to licensed health care practitioners' on the basis of the health care practitioners' decisions to limit the availability of appropriate medical tests, services, or treatments.
